pageProps.content:
Experience

Nile Safari Camp boasts a beautiful location on the mighty Nile River within Uganda’s Murchison Falls National Park.
Guests from around the world visit this area to view the thundering Murchison Falls, a 40-metre high waterfall squeezing through an 8-metre wide gap – a truly remarkable sight!
The lodge’s ideal location on the river allows guests to watch elephants playing in the water or listen to the hippos grunting in the night.

Stay

This small & intimate camp consists of only 5 wooden chalets & 5 luxury tents, all with en-suite bathrooms, indoor sitting areas & private balconies where early morning coffees can be enjoyed.
All rooms have been designed to maximize privacy & to ensure spectacular views of the Nile from the comfort of your balcony.
Nile Safari Lodge’s central area includes a large wooden deck with beautiful river views as well as a bar, swimming pool & open fire – ideal for sharing interesting stories or gazing at Africa’s starlit night sky.

Activities

Activities at camp are numerous & include boat trips to the majestic Murchison Falls down the Nile River. Other options include game drives, guided walking safaris, fishing & cultural visits to nearby villages.

subfolders.title: Baker's Lodge
subfolders.description: Baker’s Lodge enjoys a beautiful location on the southern bank of the mighty Nile River in Murchison National Park – Uganda’s largest national park, & together with adjoining wildlife reserves forms a vast wilderness covering 5,000 square km. The lodge is named after the English explorer, Samuel Baker – the first European to view the falls & name it. The Murchison National Park is home to a wide variety of wildlife, forest primates & 450 bird species.  The Nile River – the longest river in the world – flows on its 6,500 km journey from Lake Victoria to Egypt & the Mediterranean Sea.

subfolders.title: Paraa Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Set in beautiful gardens, elevated high above Murchison Falls on the north side of the River Nile lies Paraa Safari Lodge. Guests from around the world visit this area to view the thundering Murchison Falls, a 40-metre high waterfall squeezing through an 8-metre wide gap – a truly remarkable sight! The lodge’s ideal location on the river allows guests to watch plains game quench their thirst or listen to the hippos grunting in the night.
